section.title: Building a System
section.para: Now that you have defined your system repository, you use the systemstudio command to build it. The basic command validates the system definition syntax, creates the system repository, and records process results. The default level of screen output includes errors, build status and file download and creation status. SystemStudio also sends this output to the log file, by default /var/log/systemstudio.log. If a critical error occurs, SystemStudio includes detailed error information in the log file.

The initial build of a system repository can be time consuming, on the order of several minutes to an hour or more. Initial build time depends on a number of variables including the location of package repositories (local or remote), network connection speed, the number of packages included in the system repository, and the amount of content that can be reused from the SystemStudio shared cache. Subsequent builds complete in much less time, often 1-2 minutes, depending on the level and type of change since the previous build.

section.note:
If your system repository uses RHN channels as repositories, SystemStudio may occasionally report errors such as the following while downloading or verifying repository metadata:
[repos] long int too large to convert to int
This can happen when SystemStudio receives invalid data from RHN. (Typically this occurs when data is being replicated across RHN servers). The error may be corrected by running SystemStudio again, either immediately or after waiting several minutes.
